title: Gaussian surface properties when net flux is zero

content.description: Which of the following could be true for a Gaussian surface through which the net flux is zero?
content.question: I. There are no charges inside the surface. II. The net charge enclosed by the surface is zero. III. The electric field is zero everywhere on the surface.

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
